responses.rationale: The segment describes concerns and reported cases, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an event (euthanasia), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes characteristics of the virus, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a potential biological process, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment contains explicit calming language ('risk to the general public remains low').
The segment reports a specific action (sample confirmation), not a general capability or preparedness statement.
The segment describes a patient's status, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a potential future risk, not current capability or preparedness measures.
The segment contains explicit calming language ('risk to the public from H5N1 remains low').
The segment reports an event (case confirmation), not capability or preparedness measures.
Describes a potential tracking method ('another way to track').
Describes a capability ('Being able to disambiguate... and understand where these signals are coming from').
The segment describes a need for data, not a capability or preparedness measure itself.
The segment describes a limitation/need for learning, not a current capability or preparedness measure.
Describes ongoing work to improve surveillance ('review data and methodologies that may improve our public health surveillance').
Describes communication to understand potential value of testing ('in communication... to better understand the potential value').
The segment describes a current practice/limitation, not a general capability or preparedness statement.
Describes a response protocol ('agency works with state and local partners to investigate further').
Describes a surveillance tool/system ('interactive map, the CDC serves up current levels... providing needed context').
Describes a planned capability ('CDC launching wastewater dashboard to track bird flu virus spread').
Describes the potential utility of a surveillance method ('could be a reliable indicator').
Describes an action related to surveillance ('CDC began releasing data from its influenza A-tracking efforts on a public dashboard').
Describes an existing surveillance system ('operates the National Wastewater Surveillance System, which monitors 600 sites').
Describes an increase in capability ('monitoring capacity got a huge boost').
The segment reports research findings/actions, not a general capability or preparedness statement.
The segment reports publication of results, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an event (case report), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a hypothesis, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes research actions and findings, not general capability or preparedness systems.
The segment describes the use of a tool in response to an event, not a general statement about capability or preparedness.
Describes the development of a tool/capability ('developed a probe that detects H5 influenza viruses').
Describes the utility of information ('can help officials understand what may be happening').
Describes a potential capability/method ('could give communities another way to spot potential outbreaks').
Describes a planned action/capability ('will begin sharing data... on its public dashboard').
Describes an action to increase capability ('has begun scaling up H5-specific testing').
Describes a reported capability ('ability to scan wastewater for signs').
Describes a planned action/capability ('would begin testing raw cow's milk... to better understand').
Describes a monitoring action ('Scientists are watching closely for signs').
The segment contains explicit calming language ('risk to the general public remains low').
The segment reports an event (testing positive), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes patient symptoms, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes patient location/exposure, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a specific patient's treatment, not a general capability statement.
The segment describes patient symptoms, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes concerns, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports case count, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports case confirmation, not capability or preparedness measures.
Describes preparedness/safeguard measures ('farmers take steps like requiring their workers to change clothes and sanitize their boots').
The segment describes spread mechanism and location of cases, not capability or preparedness.
The segment reports impact (slaughtered birds), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports impact (lost birds), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports impact (killed birds), not capability or preparedness measures.
Describes preparedness/safeguard measures ('farmers redoubled their efforts to prevent any contact').
The segment reports an event (first detection), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports impact (slaughtered birds, prices), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes an ongoing situation, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports planned actions (killing birds), which are specific events, not general capability statements.
Describes a standard protocol/response measure ('entire flock is killed as to keep it from spreading').
The segment reports an event (virus found), not capability or preparedness measures.
Describes conditions for import ('accompanied by a permit and a treated as per regulations').
Describes an action taken as a safeguard ('applied the restriction').
The segment describes patient status, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a death and symptoms, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a characteristic of the virus, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an event (discovery), not capability or preparedness measures.
Describes preparedness/safeguard measures ('implementing strict biosecurity measures and has been following the national response').
Describes a regulation/protocol ('Permits are required to move birds...').
Describes existing and extended controls/regulations ('existing movement controls remain in place... restricted and control areas... have been extended').
Describes advice on preparedness/biosecurity practices ('advised bird owners to follow best biosecurity practices').
Describes advice on a method for minimizing contact ('housing birds... is an effective method of minimising direct contact').
Attributes detection to capability/preparedness ('ongoing surveillance activities').
The segment reports a fact about location and existing controls, not a statement about the controls as capability.
The segment reports an event (WHO advising of death), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a finding (tests identified strain), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an event (case detected, farm quarantined), not a general capability statement.
The segment reports an event (first death detected), not capability or preparedness measures.
Describes a preparedness measure/regulation ('a bird flu prevention zone was declared... legally requiring... strict biosecurity measures').
The segment reports an action following similar actions elsewhere, not a statement about capability.
Describes preparedness/safeguard measures ('ordering poultry to be kept indoors').
The segment describes transmission mechanism, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an event (outbreak reported), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a characteristic of an outbreak, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an event (outbreak reported), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an action taken (slaughtered), which is a specific event, not a general capability statement.
The segment reports an event (outbreak reported), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports case count, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes attention/interest, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes impact and past events, not current capability or preparedness.
The segment reports events (outbreaks reported) and interpretation, not capability or preparedness.
Describes response/safeguard measures ('Animals slaughtered and restrictions introduced').
The segment describes transmission mechanism, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports impact (killed pelicans), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an event (outbreak reported), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment is a question, not a statement about capability or preparedness.
Describes an action related to surveillance/research ('Health officials are investigating').
The segment describes a potential future risk, not current capability or preparedness.
The segment describes patient symptoms, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes patient exposure/location, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes patient group, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports events (outbreak emerged, cases confirmed), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment describes transmission potential, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment defines the virus and describes transmission, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports case confirmation/suspicion, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports impact (killed birds, slaughter), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an event (outbreak reported), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports case count, not capability or preparedness measures.
Describes the status of a surveillance/testing process ('Full results of genetic analysis of the sample are pending').
The segment describes risk factors, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a past event (case detected), not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports case count and symptoms, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports case count, not capability or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a specific patient's treatment, not a general capability statement.
Describes a preparedness measure ('has already secured 111 million doses... of pandemic influenza vaccines').
The segment contains explicit calming language ('risk... is considered to be low').
Describes ongoing monitoring and vaccine access ('continuously and actively monitoring the situation... ensuring access to over 40 million doses').
